radiographic_examinations.findings: Extensive air-space opacity throughout the right lung, with dense consolidation in the right upper lobe surrounding a central cavity, approximately 6 cm in diameter; patchy air-space opacity in the left lower lobe; a right pleural effusion layered posteriorly; no pneumothorax.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat chest radiograph showed a large right-sided tension pneumothorax, displacement of mediastinal structures to the left, and complete collapse of the right lung; air-space opacity in the left lower lobe was unchanged. Follow-up radiograph showed partial reexpansion of the right upper lobe, a poorly defined opacity in the left lung, and no pleural effusion. Final radiograph showed almost complete resolution of the pneumothorax, increased diffuse air-space opacity in both lungs consistent with pulmonary edema, and bilateral pleural effusions.

radiographic_examinations.findings: New right internal jugular catheter extending to superior vena cava, right tension pneumothorax with virtual collapse of the entire right lung and mediastinal structures shifted to the left.
Right chest tube in place, partial reexpansion of the right lung but persistent consolidation, atelectasis, and pneumothorax; mild interstitial pulmonary edema in the left lung.

Second chest tube in right hemithorax; almost complete resolution of the pneumothorax; increasing diffuse air-space opacity in both lungs, consistent with pulmonary edema and bilateral pleural effusions.
